result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcus M Malone was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.
 
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of  6  MONTHS in the House of Correction, STRAIGHT TIME, with credit for 10 days time served.  

The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation to the State Department of Corrections for a period of 1 YEAR.

Conditions of probation include:
-ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
-AODA and other counseling needs to be determined; random urine screens.
-Seek and maintain full-time employment.
-Perform 20 hours of community service at a non-profit charitable organization.
-No contact with Drugs, Drug Users, or Drug Paraphernalia.  


Court WAIVED all costs and surcharges due to inability to pay.  
FILED:   Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit; Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY to charge on AMENDED INFORMATION and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Defendant Marcus M Malone in court with attorney Robert Lee Taylor.  Defendant Marcus M. Malone in custody.  Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of a PRELIMINARY HEARING commencing on 03-19-2014 received and filed. (13 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to ASSISTANT STATE PUBLIC DEFENDER GREG RENDEN, 2025 E Greenwich Ave., Ste. 215, Milwaukee, WI  53211.

Defendant Marcus Malone in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  William Berens, student intern under the supervision of Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding case #10CM1048 that are attached to the complaint.  Sworn for the state:Thomas Kresa-MPD Officer.     State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 44.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 3/18/14.
css

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  To be monitored by drug testing.   No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Marcus Malone in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Marcus Malone in custody.  Karine E. O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 19, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
